title: Nanoconfined carbonization enabling high-density porous carbon for jointly superior gravimetric and volumetric zinc-ion storage
content:
Energy Environ. Sci., 2024, Advance Article
DOI: 10.1039/D4EE02163K, Paper
Jiacong Lu, Xinyue Zhong, Xiaomin Lin, Jiuqing Gui, Mingtao Zheng, Yingliang Liu, Yeru Liang
Jointly exceptional gravimetric and volumetric capacitances in porous carbons were achieved through nanoconfined carbonization. Critical roles of 1.2â€“5.5 nm pores for zinc-ion storage and pores above 5.5 nm for rapid ion diffusion were revealed.
